title: Transcribing Kartini: Using handwritten text recognition technology to unlock UNESCO 'Memory of the World' letters
content: During her internship at the Leiden University Libraries’ Centre for Digital Scholarship, Kayla Varga used an approach combining AI and human input to make reading historic letters more accessible and efficient.

title: GO FAIR Foundation Fellowship: Implementing FAIR data practices at Leiden University
content: Recently qualified GO FAIR Foundation Three-Point FAIRification Framework facilitators Kristina Hettne and Alessa Gambardella write about what this is, their training, and implementing FAIR data practices at Leiden University.

title: The why, how and what of publishing research data
content: Each year, on the first Thursday of November, World Digital Preservation Day is celebrated. In honor of today, we share our thoughts on depositing research data in a data repository. Happy World Digital Preservation Day!

title: Impact on ownership when choosing an NC or ND Creative Commons Licence
content: Did you know you may be giving away some of your author rights to the publisher when you choose an open access licence which prohibits commercial reuse or production of derivatives (i.e. by applying a CC BY-NC, CC BY-ND or CC BY-NC-ND licence)?

title: The CDS Summer Training Week 2025: looking back and useful materials going forward
content: From 23 to 27 June, the third CDS Summer Training Week brought together over 70 participants for a series of workshops, lectures, and interactive sessions.

title: How can we monitor where Leiden researchers deposit their data? A comparative analysis between open sources
content: Datasets are increasingly deposited and published by Leiden University researchers. But where do they do this and how can we find out? During her internship at the Leiden University Libraries’ Centre for Digital Scholarship and the CWTS, Korina Lemonidou researched this question.

title: The new Leiden University Employer Copyright Regulations offer clarification on Leiden’s policy on copyright
content: On the 10th of February 2025, the Leiden University Employer Copyright Regulations were published. What does this mean for the academic community of Leiden University? And why was it deemed necessary in the first place?

title: Love Data Week 2025 @CDS
content: It’s International Love Data Week! The theme this year is “Whose data is it, anyway?” This week, we at the Leiden University Libraries’ Centre for Digital Scholarship share our love of data through the following events.

title: Key insights from the symposium on AI and Academic Publishing
content: On 7 November 2024, the UBL and Elsevier jointly organised a symposium on AI and academic publishing.

title: Getting started with AI at Leiden University
content: Artificial Intelligence (AI) has introduced itself into everyone's lives. Naturally, Leiden University Libraries also has to address the development of AI. In this blogpost, I will give a short introduction to (Gen)AI and its effects on the university library.
